subject: Re: Even the guys say....
author: LC Duplatt
full_text:
Yes, equipment differences (I noticed some earbuds do not pick up 
half of what headphones are good speakers do) and also what I would 
call a "syncopated rhythm" present with some of the messages.  That's 
my old music training coming out of me and used to describe a spacing 
between words spelling out a message, such as a word spoken every 
other second, etc - sounds abnormal in regular conversation but with 
some of these recordings it happens quite frequently.  Maybe this is 
due to the frequency changes, which also sometimes creates sort of a 
skip:  "They may (may) be able to (to) help me."

LC

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Misty" <bulletbabea@...> wrote:
>
> I tend to be more surprised when they hear it exactly as I do. 
Often 
> its not on the "clearer" ones that I think everyone will hear. 
> Sometimes we upload the clearest files and others dont hear it. 
That 
> can be for a number of reasons. Perception and equipment being used 
> for playback as well as individual hearing differs, etcetera. I 
know 
> when I listen to my own files on different speakers or headphones 
the 
> sound quality differs. It's just clearer on some than others.
> 
> Misty
> 
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@> 
> wrote:
